revised_title: Neutron Scattering and Structure Analysis of Nucleosome Core Particles
tldr: Researchers used neutron scattering to study the structure of nucleosome core particles, which are the basic units of chromatin. They found that the particles have a flat, wedge-shaped structure with DNA wound into a superhelix around a histone octamer. The study provides insights into the arrangement of DNA and histone proteins in the nucleosome core, which is essential for understanding gene regulation and DNA packaging in cells.
